column4: Hello, I have Windows Vista installed in C, I installed Ubuntu in drive D .. before that I moved all my files to drive E.. unfortuanetely.. I could read those files before I install Ubuntu, after installing Ubuntu I am now unable to read my files in drive E... All my files are unreadable now, any suggestions?
can you get into them on Windows?
no, even though when I boot with Vista I am still not able to open them
The files are thre with thier original icons. I am not able to open them
I mean  get your files open in Windows first,  then you can  open stuff up in Ubuntu to probably
as long as Windows partitions are shut down properly, Ubuntu should be able to just use them
the problem is that I am not able to open them in windows too
,but maybe you got a currupted partitiion
yes exactly, which means  you have problem all written over it
if you can get them working in Windows,  then  they should just work in  Ubuntu as well, as long as that partition was shut down properly
,but something has happended,  and it's a Windows partition and all that, so  makes sense to ask in ##windows
if you can get it working in Windows properly,  what I said about Ubuntu
